intro: Canthium mombazense, commonly known as Mombasa spurge, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathium structures, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
